author: Staff Reporter
text:
Kanyakumari Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan receiving petitions from women members of fishermen families at the collectorate in Nagercoil on Friday.

The district administration has sent a detailed proposal to the government for repairing damaged groynes to a total length of 785 metres in Kanyakumari district and another proposal for constructing groyne in Melmidalam, according to Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan.

Addressing the monthly fishermen grievance day meeting here on Friday, Mr. Chavan said that proposals were also sent to celebrate November 21, World Fishermen Day, as a government event, and establish a marine training centre in a coastal village in the district.

It was also informed in the meeting that Animal Husbandry Department had been directed to control street dog menace in Colachal.

Under modernisation programme, construction of drainage facility and laying of tiles were in progress at the fish market in Thingal Nagar town panchayat at an estimated cost of Rs. 20 lakh. Garbage was removed from the daily market, the officials said.

Fishermen demanded that they should be allowed to carry subsidised kerosene to Ramanathapuram and Thoothukudi by road while going for fishing, and complained that flying squads of Civil Supplies Department conducted raids at villages in the nights and seized kerosene.

Mr. Chavan received 111 petitions and disbursed Rs. 1 lakh each to two fishermen who died while fishing under Group Insurance Scheme.

Assistant Director of Fisheries S. Rubert Jothi and other officials participated.
title: “Proposals sent to government to construct and repair groynes”
